Package me.bristermitten.mittenlib.config.provider.construct

Interface ConfigProviderFactory

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleConfigProviderFactory
public interface ConfigProviderFactory
Creates ConfigProviders for Configurations

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    <T> @NotNull Result<ConfigProvider<T>>
    createProvider(Configuration<T> configuration)
    Creates the simplest ConfigProvider possible for the given Configuration.
    <T> @NotNull Result<ConfigProvider<T>>
    createStringReaderProvider(String data, Configuration<T> configuration)
    Deprecated.
    This method makes use of SearchingObjectLoader, which cannot efficiently process Strings.
    <T> @NotNull Result<ConfigProvider<T>>
    createStringReaderProvider(FileType type, String data, Configuration<T> configuration)
    Creates a ConfigProvider that reads a given String for its data, rather than a file.

  • Method Details

    • createProvider

      @NotNull <T> @NotNull Result<ConfigProvider<T>> createProvider(Configuration<T> configuration)
      Creates the simplest ConfigProvider possible for the given Configuration. This will generally not include fancy things like caching, auto reloading, etc. See ConfigProviderImprover to add extra functionality.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the configuration
      Parameters:
      configuration - the configuration to create a provider for
      Returns:
      the created provider

    • createStringReaderProvider

      @Deprecated @NotNull <T> @NotNull Result<ConfigProvider<T>> createStringReaderProvider(String data, Configuration<T> configuration)
      Deprecated.
      This method makes use of SearchingObjectLoader, which cannot efficiently process Strings. Use createStringReaderProvider(FileType, String, Configuration) instead to manually specify a file type
      Creates a ConfigProvider that reads a given String for its data, rather than a file. While implementations may differ, one can safely assume that the value of Configuration.getFileName() will be irrelevant.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the configuration
      Parameters:
      data - the data to read
      configuration - the configuration to create a provider for
      Returns:
      the created provider

    • createStringReaderProvider

      @NotNull <T> @NotNull Result<ConfigProvider<T>> createStringReaderProvider(FileType type, String data, Configuration<T> configuration)
      Creates a ConfigProvider that reads a given String for its data, rather than a file. While implementations may differ, one can safely assume that the value of Configuration.getFileName() will be irrelevant.

      This method also accepts a FileType whose FileType.loader() will be used to load the data. If you don't know the file type, use createStringReaderProvider(String, Configuration) instead, but be aware that performance may suffer from this approach, as it may have to check multiple FileTypes.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the configuration
      Parameters:
      type - the file type to use
      data - the data to read
      configuration - the configuration to create a provider for
      Returns:
      the created provider
